column4: How would I get set permissions so that ALL USERS in group x can do nothing except for R/W files in their home directory?
each user to r/w only their home directory, or each group user r/w each group user's home dir
I want them only to be able to r/w to THEIR OWN home directory. I'm running a family web server. I don't want "sally" editing /home/mark/public_html etc... etc...
i mean, they'll be able to r/w any other files out there that have the Y in the XXY of permissions set to where they can read
i'd just go read about chmod, chgrp, chown using the 'man' command
then you need a script that runs a "chmod ~/ 750"
use a recurseive chmod command on all of "/home/*"
but then what if the user runs say /etc/init.d/apache2 stop
that will reset EVERY file and directory to whatever you tell it to in the home directory
go to init.d and do a "ls -l" and then tell us what the permissions are on it
i seriously doubt that anyone can execute in init.d
remember first number = root, 2nd number = group, 3rd number = anyone
yes. by default. but I'm retarded. and did "chmod +rwx" on some stuff while installing
if you've borked your permissions that much, why not backup your home dirs and reinstall?
